meanings.definition: To cause something to lose its color.
meanings.sent1: The artist accidentally decolorizes the canvas while cleaning it.
meanings.sent2: Exposure to harsh chemicals decolorizes the once bright flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy painter decolorizes the palette, creating a new abstract masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The rain decolorizes the graffiti on the wall, washing away its vibrancy.
meanings.sent5: The pollution in the river decolorizes the fish, turning them pale.
